column4: hi guys, is anyone having trouble accessing 'http://www.ubuntulinux.org/' right now?  For some reason I can't reach it (timeout on dns lookup)
fine here
odd... it's the only site I don't seem to be able to access at the moment.
hum
peter@snoopy ~ $ host www.ubuntulinux.org
www.ubuntulinux.org has address 82.211.81.130
the ip address came straight up to canonical's website, so it's definitely just something weird at my end
mmm.. goat...
nameserver 62.241.162.200
is my first nameserver
not sure if you can use it outside my isp mind :|
hmmm
most nameservers work no matter what ISP you're on... they're not as strict as (for example) smtp
could be my gentoo installation just doesn't want me talking to the ubuntu site ;-)
I'm on gentoo here :P
lol... obviously your installation is more open minded
asking for help in ubuntu is a lot easier in than when using gentoo though
really? why's that?
Slave:gentoo has a lot of hostility towards it
for example: go into #gaim and say "my gaim appears to segfault. I'm using gentoo.. any ideas?"
do you mean that the gentoo channel is unfriendly?
most developers are
hmmm, it's been ages and ages since I've been in there.. but at the time it was pretty friendly
